sen.e: On May 28, 1228, he died young at the age of 21, and his younger brother, Tokitane CHIBA is said to have succeeded to him ("Azuma Kagami" [The Mirror of the East], "Chiba Taikeizu").

sen.j: ただし、本土寺の過去帳に載せられている「千葉介代々御先祖次第」には、「第四 胤綱 卅一歳、安貞二年戊午五月廿八日」と記されており、また承久の乱で14歳の若武者が一軍を率いるという年齢的な問題もあることから、享年31を採用して建久9年（1198年）生まれとし、『千葉大系図』では成胤の子（胤綱の弟）とされている時胤・千葉泰綱兄弟を胤綱の実子とする説もある。
sen.e: However, the "Chibanosuke Daidai Gosenzo Shidai" described in a family register of deaths of Hondo-ji Temple states that '4th, Tanetsuna, 31 years old, May 28, 1228,' and there is also a problem in age that a samurai as young as 14 years old would lead an army, and accordingly, there are some opinions stating that he would have been born in 1198, adopting an age of death of 31, and that the brothers, Tokitane and Yasutsuna CHIBA, who were indicated as children of Naritane (younger brother of Tanetsuna) in "Chiba Taikeizu," would be biological children of Tanetsuna.
sen.cmt: 「千葉介代々御先祖次第」は"Chibanosuke Daidai Gosenzo Shidai"と訳出しています（登録）。
sen.e: However, the 'Chibanosuke Daidai Gosenzo Shidai' writeen in a family register of deaths of Hondo-ji Temple has a record, '4th, Tanetsuna, 31 years old, July 8, 1228,' and there is also a problem of how a samurai as young as 14 years old could lead an army in the Jokyu War, and accordingly, there is another argument that he was born in 1198 adopting his age of death being 31, and that Tokitane and Yasutsuna CHIBA brohthers, who were indicated as children of Naritane (younger brother of Tanetsuna) in "Chiba Taikeizu," were biological children of Tanetsuna.
sen.cmt: 文章の流れを良くするため、数か所変えました。

sen.j: 『古今著聞集』によると、年若い胤綱が将軍御所の侍の間で、当時権勢を振るっていた重鎮の三浦義村の上座に座り、義村が「下総の犬めは寝場所を知らぬな」と皮肉ると、胤綱は「三浦の犬は友を食らうぞ」と切り返し、和田合戦での義村の裏切りを批判したという。
sen.e: According to "Kokon chomon ju" (A collection of Tales Heard, Past and Present), Tanetsuna, when he was young, sat a Kamiza (seat of honor) of Yoshimura MIURA, who was dominating as an authority at that time, in the room for samurais in the Shogun's palace, and Yoshimura made sarcastic remarks that 'that dog in Shimousa Province would not know where to find a bed,' then Tanetsuna is said to have fought back that 'that dog in Miura family would eat a friend,' and criticized Yoshimura's betrayal at the Battle of Wada.

According to "Kokon chomon ju" (A collection of Tales Heard, Past and Present), when Yoshimura MIURA, who was dominating as an authority at that time, saw Tanetsuna, as a young man, take a seat for more valuable person than the one Yoshimura took in the room for samurais in the Shogun's palace and said sarcastictically, 'that dog from Shimousa Province would not know where to find a bed,' then Tanetsuna is said to have fought back saying 'that dog of the Miura family would eat a friend,' and criticized Yoshimura's betrayal at the Battle of Wada.
sen.cmt: 文章の流れを良くするため、数か所変えました。「三浦義村の上座」は、三浦義村よりもより上座、と考えて 'seat of honor' よりも 'seat for valuable person' とし、比較級の more valuable にしました。
sen.e: According to "Kokon chomon ju" (A collection of Tales Heard, Past and Present), when Yoshimura MIURA, who was dominating as an authority at that time, saw Tanetsuna, as a young man, take a seat for more valuable person than the one Yoshimura took in the room for samurais in the Shogun's palace and said sarcastictically, 'that dog from Shimousa Province would not know where to find a bed,' then Tanetsuna is said to have fought back saying 'that dog of the Miura family would eat a friend,' and criticized Yoshimura's betrayal at the Battle of Wada.
